original: @382a rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @382a rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya lo ha dunde n'a ma dh'a ra n'i /
analyzed: a'arya lo ha dunde n'a ma dh'a ra n'i /
translated: Ārya-lohadanda-nāma-dhāraṇī

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: 'phags pa lcags kyi mchu zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
analyzed: 'phags pa lcags kyi mchu zhes bya ba'i gzungs /
translated: The Noble Dhāraṇī Called Iron Beak

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das @382b yul ma ga dha nas rgyu zhing aa mra'i tshal du gshegs te byon nas aa mra'i tshal du lus 'phags ri'i dbang po'i brag phug na bzhugs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @382b yul ma ga dha nas rgyu zhing aa mra'i tshal du gshegs te byon nas aa mra'i tshal du lus 'phags ri'i dbang po'i brag phug na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One was traveling through Magadha and arrived at the Mango Grove. He stayed in the cave of the Lord of the Mountain of the Auspicious in the Mango Grove.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas bcom ldan 'das la mgo bos phyag 'tshal te phyogs gcig tu 'dug nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, went to where the Blessed One was. Having arrived, he bowed his head to the Blessed One's feet. Sitting to one side, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽lha ma yin rnams ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / lha ma yin rnams ni /
translated: Blessed One!🔽The asuras

original: rab tu lha rnams kyi yun ring bo'i dgra lags na /
analyzed: rab tu lha rnams kyi yun ring bo'i dgra lags na /
translated: are long-standing enemies of the gods.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis dran pa'i chos bstan du gsol /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis dran pa'i chos bstan du gsol /
translated: The Blessed One should teach the Dharma of mindfulness.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i 'jig rten sh'akya thub pa'i zhing khams na mir gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'khor na dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul pha dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang /
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling pa'i 'jig rten sh'akya thub pa'i zhing khams na mir gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'khor na dge slong pha dang / dge slong ma dang / dge tshul pha dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang /
translated: In the realm of Śākyamuni, the world of Jambudvīpa, among the retinue of sentient beings who have become humans, there are monks, nuns, male and female novices, male and female lay followers,

original: dam pa'i chos 'jig pa la srung ba'i thabs bstan du gsol /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos 'jig pa la srung ba'i thabs bstan du gsol /
translated: Please teach the means of protecting the destruction of the sublime Dharma.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

original: lha'i dbang po /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po /
translated: Lord of the Gods,

original: khyod kyis lcags kyi mchu'i gzungs /
analyzed: khyod kyis lcags kyi mchu'i gzungs /
translated: you should hold the iron-beaked one,

original: thams cad skrag par byed pa /
analyzed: thams cad skrag par byed pa /
translated: which terrifies all,

original: lha ma yin la thog smad lnga 'bebs pa /
analyzed: lha ma yin la thog smad lnga 'bebs pa /
translated: which brings down five-thunderbolts on the asuras,

original: 'jig rten gyi rims nad zhi bar byed pa; 'jig rten thams cad du zhi bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rims nad zhi bar byed pa; 'jig rten thams cad du zhi bar byed pa /
translated: which pacifies the epidemic diseases of the world, which brings peace to the entire world,

original: dug thams cad 'jil ba /
analyzed: dug thams cad 'jil ba /
translated: which destroys all poisons,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to all the world,🔽 which brings peace to

original: mtshon thams cad rengs par byed pa /
analyzed: mtshon thams cad rengs par byed pa /
translated: It paralyzes all weapons.

original: rkang med pa dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi thams cad rengs @383a *//🔽par byed pa /
analyzed: rkang med pa dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi thams cad rengs @383a *// par byed pa /
translated: It paralyzes all those with no legs, two legs, or four legs.

original: dgra thams cad phung bar byed pa /
analyzed: dgra thams cad phung bar byed pa /
translated: It destroys all enemies.

original: lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / sbyin byed ma'i bu dang / sha za dang / brjed byed dang / smyo byed dang / 'gro ba drag shul du spyod pa rab tu 'jig par byed pa /
analyzed: lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / sbyin byed ma'i bu dang / sha za dang / brjed byed dang / smyo byed dang / 'gro ba drag shul du spyod pa rab tu 'jig par byed pa /
translated: It utterly destroys asuras, garuḍas, kumbhāṇḍas, piśācas, bhūtas, unmādas, and grahas.🔽It pacifies all quarrels, disputes, arguments, and slander.

original: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i 'phags pa lcags mchu 'di zungs shig /
analyzed: 'thab pa dang / rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa dang / mtshang 'dru ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i 'phags pa lcags mchu 'di zungs shig /
translated: You should uphold this noble Iron Beak dhāraṇī.

original: thams cad mi 'jigs pa'i lcags kyi mchu'i gzungs kyi sngags brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi 'jigs pa'i lcags kyi mchu'i gzungs kyi sngags brjod par bya'o //
translated: You should recite the spell of the dhāraṇī of the iron beak that grants fearlessness to all.🔽Tadyathā:

original: tadya th'a / ba ga tsa ni /
analyzed: tadya th'a / ba ga tsa ni /
translated: Bagacani

original: shu ti shu ma li /
analyzed: shu ti shu ma li /
translated: Śuti śumali

original: ga sha sha sha ta ta b'i ra ti /
analyzed: ga sha sha sha ta ta b'i ra ti /
translated: Gaśa śaśa tatavīrati

original: hu yu hu yu ri ti sv'ah'a /
analyzed: hu yu hu yu ri ti sv'ah'a /
translated: Huyuryurīti svāhā

original: rgya mtsho la 'bar li ti gtor ro //
analyzed: rgya mtsho la 'bar li ti gtor ro //
translated: Offer oblations to the ocean.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa 'bab bo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa 'bab bo //
translated: It will rain as much as you desire.

original: klu'i gnas su phur bu sa ya bye ba grangs med pa bzlas la klu'i gnas su btab na /
analyzed: klu'i gnas su phur bu sa ya bye ba grangs med pa bzlas la klu'i gnas su btab na /
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred million times over a kīla in the abode of the nāgas and plants it in the abode of the nāgas,

original: ser ba dang / thog ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'bab bo //
analyzed: ser ba dang / thog ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'bab bo //
translated: hail and lightning will fall as one wishes.

original: sarba n'a g'a n'am aa pa b'iry'a phob /
analyzed: sarba n'a g'a n'am aa pa b'iry'a phob /
translated: sarvanāgānāmapāyarya phaṭ

original: n'a ga shar shar phob /
analyzed: n'a ga shar shar phob /
translated: nāga śara śara phaṭ

original: n'a ga raksha phob /
analyzed: n'a ga raksha phob /
translated: nāgarakṣa phaṭ

original: ri tsa sri badzra h'um phat/🔽drag po yul khams kyi dgrar gyur pa zlog pa /🔽mes gtor ba'i thog smad lnga 'bebs pa /
analyzed: ri tsa sri badzra h'um phat/ drag po yul khams kyi dgrar gyur pa zlog pa / mes gtor ba'i thog smad lnga 'bebs pa /
translated: ricā sṛva vajra hūṃ phaṭ

original: lha'i dbang po thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i lcags kyi mchu'i gzungs ' di lha ma yin rmongs su 'jug pa /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po thams cad zil gyis mnan pa'i lcags kyi mchu'i gzungs ' di lha ma yin rmongs su 'jug pa /
translated: This dhāraṇī of the iron beak, which overpowers all lords of the gods, defeats the asuras,

original: 'khor rnam bzhi srung ba /
analyzed: 'khor rnam bzhi srung ba /
translated: protects the four retinues,

original: theg pa chen po'i chos dgra srung ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i chos dgra srung ba'o //
translated: and protects the enemies of the Mahāyāna teachings.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin yi rang ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin yi rang ste /
translated: When the Blessed One had said this, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, rejoiced and

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: praised the Blessed One's words.

original: 'phags @383b pa lcags mchu'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
analyzed: 'phags @383b pa lcags mchu'i gzungs rdzogs so ////
translated: The noble dhāraṇī of the iron beak is complete.
